Create an environment of shared crates.

Source: R/utils-crate.R
dot-super_crate.Rd

Crated functions that share the same data in a single dependency free environment.

Usage

.super_crate(
  .fns,
  ...,
  .parent_env = baseenv(),
  .error_arg = ".fn",
  .error_call = environment(),
  .nsqualify = FALSE
)

Arguments

.fns

a named list of functions

...

Named arguments to declare in the environment of .fn.

.parent_env

The default of baseenv() ensures that the evaluation environment of the crate is isolated from the search path. Specifying another environment such as the global environment allows this condition to be relaxed (but at the expense of no longer being able to rely on a local run giving the same results as one in a different process).

.error_arg

An argument name as a string. This argument will be mentioned in error messages as the input that is at the origin of a problem.

.error_call

The execution environment of a currently running function, e.g. caller_env(). The function will be mentioned in error messages as the source of the error. See the call argument of abort() for more information.

.nsqualify

check for undefined global references and qualify namespaces?

Value

an environment containing crated functions

Unit tests



msg = "hello"
e = .super_crate(
  list(
    plusx = function(z) {
     return(z+x)
    },
    plusy = function(z) {
     return(z+y+plusx(z))
    }
    # splicing does not work
    # hi = function() {
    #   print(!!msg)
    # }
  ),
  x = 1:10,
  y = 11:20
)

testthat::expect_equal(
  e$plusy(1),
  c(14, 16, 18, 20, 22, 24, 26, 28, 30, 32)
)
